713910f-a.title: Manhattan: 57th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
713910f-a.text:
West 57th Street, north side, east from a point (No. 319,
left) to the west of Eichth Avenue, across same to Broadway
(extreme right). Silhouetted amainst the new General Motors Bldg.
is the Church of the Strangers (P.E.) at No. 309 W. 57th Street.
This structure, built as a memorial to Dr. Charles F. Deems in
1870 by the Universalist Church of Our Saviour, vas sold to the
present occupants about 1899 and will shortly be demolished.
View No. 2 shows the Chhurch mainly,as ohserved northward
across a excavation on the south side of the Street. hoses Ling 's
Mand book of New York (1892), on page 351, states that Chuurch of
the Strangers at No. 299 Mercer Street was purchased by Commodore
Vanderbilt in 1870 and presented to Dr. Deems, a former M.E.
clergyman from Rorth Carolina. His preaching attracted great
attention and he organized this church in 1868 with out organic
Connectionswith any other denomination.

713917f-a.title: Manhattan: 57th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
713917f-a.text:
330 to 368 West 57th Street, south side, west from (No. 330, 4-story
basement structure on left), a point midway between Eighth and Ninth
Aves., to the latter (right, elevated line thereon). The 6-story Hotel
Calumet (No. 340) and the vacant lot adjoining same (Nos. 332-334,
formerly the site of the Church of 2ion and St. Timothy) will provide
the ground for the present Parc VVendome Apartments.
April 1926.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

713921f-a.title: Manhattan: 57th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
713921f-a.text:
355-309 West 57th Street, north side, between Ninth and Eighth
AVes. At the extreme left is the new American Women's Association Build-
ing. The apartment house at the extreme right replaced the Protestant
Episcopal Church of the Strangers. The view is northeastward from clear-
ance (present site of Parc Vendome Apartments) on the south side of the
street and between the aforementioned Aves.
January 9, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The New York Times of March 13, 194o reports the sale of a site
known as No. 331-45 West 57th Street and 334-46 West 58th Street.
Two eight-story apartments will be constructed here constituting
a project with frontages of 160 feet on the former thoroughfare
and 137 on the latter. This is directly opposite the Parc Ven-
dome Apartments and half a block east of the A. W. A. Bldg.
